Description: Join us for a pivotal session on ‘KRAS: Broadening the Attack Beyond G12C,’ where we move past the familiar terrain of G12C mutations to the potential of targeting more common K-Ras mutants. We’ll discuss emerging small molecule strategies, focusing on the development of cutting-edge covalent G12D reactive compounds and the intricate mechanisms of tri-complex cyclophilin recruiting molecules. Alongside, we will examine the synergy between these molecular advances and immuno-oncology, highlighting the role of mutation-associated neoantigen-specific antibodies in orchestrating powerful immune response against K-Ras mutant driven cancers.
Location: Ballroom 20 AB - Upper Level - Convention Center
